content.raw:
Actually I ran it again a couple more times and the service call was fine, so I don’t know what was happening the first time. I found another bug though that should be unrelated. But we don’t check that the task is ready to call the service, we just wait for the service. We report a constant anyway, and the docking behavior is not robust when there are other things around, so it was not a serious attempt at that task.

‌

Actually I ran it again a couple more times and the service call was fine, so I don’t know what was happening the first time. I found another bug though that should be unrelated. But we don’t check that the task is ready to call the service, we just wait for the service. We report a constant anyway, and the docking behavior is not robust when there are other things around, so it was not a serious attempt at that task.
